settings.title: The Handsling Difference
Performance & Ride Experience
settings.content:
• Endurance control: composed handling on rough surfaces – ideal for long-distance cycling on UK roads.
  • Power you can hold: oversized head tube, large down tube and full width BB86 shell keep responses crisp without harshness.
  • Efficient pace: aero D-shaped tube profiles with integrated hidden cable routing help you maintain speed.
  • Comfort headroom: refined carbon lay-up, a narrow D-shaped seatpost and clearance up to 32mm tyres reduce road buzz and improve comfort over long miles.

settings.title: Frame Design & Manufacture
settings.content:
• UCI-approved, in-house design built in the proprietary moulds using Toray T800 carbon.
  • Internal EPS moulding for high compaction and clean internal finish.
  • Asymmetric fork and chainstays manage disc-brake and pedalling forces for efficient power transfer and stability under braking.
  • Aero profiles with D-shape seatpost deliver an aerodynamic design that handles well in cross winds.
  • Rigorous testing beyond ISO standards; frames and moulds are owned/controlled by Handsling.

settings.title: A1R0evo: Our Flagship Carbon Endurance Road Bike
settings.content:
The A1R0evo brings the best of endurance road bikes to a custom build. The frame is manufactured using Toray T800 carbon that combines light weight with durability.

While stiff and aero, the A1R0evo is optimised for all-day endurance rides with a tapered seattube and narrow seatpost absorbing road vibration, plus clearance for wider 32mm tyres to aid comfort on rough surfaces. Backed by UCI approval and refined with racer feedback, it arrives assembled to your measurements and ready for all-day efforts.

Set the Fit, Chase the Miles

One position you trust – speed you can hold. Make it yours.

You feel it on long climbs and over rolling terrain – the same crisp, responsive feel, just with less weight to bring up to speed.

settings.title: What are endurance road bikes for?
settings.content: Endurance road bikes are set up for comfort and control over long distances. The focus is a sustainable fit (stack/reach and cockpit set to you), wider-volume tyres to cut road buzz, and component choices that you can depend on for hours. At Handsling, the same UCI-approved platforms as our flagship carbon road bikes and road bikes for racing are configured for endurance through Remote Tailored Sizing, tyre selection and wheel choice – so you can hold steady on the roads with less fatigue.

settings.title: Why choose a carbon endurance road bike?
settings.content: A carbon endurance road bike balances low weight, stiffness and vibration damping. Carbon’s moulded tube shapes allow clean aerodynamics and internal cable routing, while targeted lay-ups keep the chassis responsive without feeling harsh. Add wider-tyre clearance and you get a bike that holds speed, calms road buzz and remains comfortable for long-distance cycling.

settings.title: Which Handsling endurance bike is best for me – the A1R0evo or A1R0evoS?
settings.content: Choose A1R0evo if you want a balanced all-rounder for endurance: efficient, composed handling with up to 32mm tyre clearance and a fit you can hold all day. Pick A1R0evoS if you want the same geometry and feel with less weight at equal stiffness (T1100 lay-up) to make long climbs and steady tempo that bit easier. We’ll confirm the right option for your routes and fit during Remote Tailored Sizing.

settings.title: What is the difference between an endurance road bike and an all road bike?
settings.content: An endurance road bike prioritises long-mile comfort and predictable handling on tarmac, typically with 28–32 mm tyres and geometry you can maintain for hours. “All-road” usually shifts further toward mixed surfaces – often wider tyres again, and a setup aimed at rougher lanes or light gravel. If most rides are paved and you value sustained speed and fit sustainability, endurance is the better match.

settings.title: Are long distance road bikes good for beginners?
settings.content: Yes, if you’re new to road cycling, a long distance road bike’s stable handling and comfort-focused setup can make learning smoother. Wider tyres, a sensible cockpit height and a measured fit help you ride longer without fatigue. With Handsling, you can start with reliable components, then upgrade wheels or gearing later; the core carbon frame and fit remain the foundation.

settings.title: Do you offer cycle to work and finance options for your endurance road bikes?
settings.content: Yes. We support cycle to work schemes and offer finance on eligible builds and framesets. During your quote we’ll confirm available providers and terms so you can choose the payment route that suits your budget.

settings.title: What is the lead time for your bespoke carbon endurance bikes?
settings.content: Typical lead time is around 4-6 weeks, depending on paint choice and component availability. We confirm your fit first, agree the specification, book the paint slot, then assemble and quality-check in our workshop. If you have an event deadline, we’ll advise in-stock options to keep timings tight.

settings.title: Can I visit your UK factory for a fitting?
settings.content: Yes. You can book an in-person fitting at our Hampshire facility or use Remote Tailored Sizing from home. We’ll confirm stack/reach, bar width and saddle height, discuss gearing, wheels and tyres, and finalise your build before assembly.
